sentences.english: On the other hand, the cost of maintaining social order is rising.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，维护社会秩序的成本在上升。

sentences.english: Please obey the rules, NOT to crowd or play around when you are touring.
sentences.chinese: 参观游览时，请遵守秩序，不要拥挤打闹。

sentences.english: Event cards represent shifts in the world order of Vigil.
sentences.chinese: 将代表着祈夜世界秩序的轮换。

sentences.english: The cosmos has solemn order and orbicular harmony.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙具有严整的秩序，圆满的和谐。

sentences.english: The battle lines of the new world order were exposed at the World Trade Organization this week.
sentences.chinese: 本周，新世界秩序的各条战线在世界贸易组织曝光了。

sentences.english: Then reality becomes a perfect model that the order of all the forms entangles in integration.
sentences.chinese: 现实也变成了所有纠缠于一体的形式秩序的完美模型。

sentences.english: Equal competition is the core of market order.
sentences.chinese: 平等竞争是市场秩序的核心。

sentences.english: Dharma refers to one's place in the natural order of events.
sentences.chinese: 德性指的是，在事件的自然秩序中一个人的位置。

sentences.english: They perturbed good social order with their rumours.
sentences.chinese: 他们用谣言扰乱了良好的社会秩序。

sentences.english: You also get 2 special in-game items with your pre-order.
sentences.chinese: 您也可以得到2个特别在游戏中的物品与您的前秩序。

sentences.english: Some teachers find it difficult to keep their classes in order.
sentences.chinese: 有些教师感到难以维持课堂秩序。
他在芜杂中创建着秩序。

sentences.english: The confusion caused by the traffic order is inefficient because of traffic.
sentences.chinese: 这些混乱的交通秩序是造成交通效率低下的原因。

sentences.english: You get to set the deadlines, and manage your own priorities.
sentences.chinese: 你擅长设定最后期限，自行安排事情的优先秩序。

sentences.english: Angry crowds and RouZi looking for bonzi team conflict to keep order.
sentences.chinese: 激愤的群众与肉孜找来维持秩序的棒子队发生冲突。

sentences.english: While improving democracy, network expression may have its adverse effect upon maintenance of social order.
sentences.chinese: 网络表达具有增进民主和诱致秩序失范的双重属性。

definition: to defend/to safeguard/to protect/to uphold/to maintain
norm/standard/specification/regulation/rule/within the rules/to fix rules/to regulate/to specify
to comply with/to abide by/to respect (an agreement)
to control/to restrict/(PRC law) non-custodial sentence with specified restrictions on one's activities for up to 3 years (e.g. not to participate in demonstrations)
